Posts.Content: skippyrcis wrote: My BM with TE was 2/16th.  We did the nipple/tissue sparing surgery.  My husband told me that the doctor found abnormal cells and took part of my nipple (must be from behind it because I can not tell).  He told my husband that there was less then a 10% chance of it being anything.  My appointment is Tuesday with the BS.  I have tried not to think about it.  What could this mean.  Is it a possibility that he may have to take me back to surgery to take my nipple or could it mean that I will have to do chemo or rads.  I have not thought about either much because I was told that with my type of cancer I would probably escape both.  I guess I need to schedule with an oncologist right......Has anyone been here? Thank you Skippy  Dx 1/2/2009, IDC, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What could happen? skippyrcis skippyrcis

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2009 05:28PM skippyrcis wrote: Hello Ladies, I went to my appointments today and got good news.  My BS said that they found the abnormal cells near the nipple and did a second sample from the tip of the nipple.  That was clean.  So I get to keep my nipples. YEAH!!  I choose initially to do a surgical biopsy.  With the BM they did find another ductal insitu.  So now I am good.  I found out that we will do the oncocyte test to determine if I need chemo.  He does not think I will need it.  Also they are having trouble deciding exactly how big my tumors were.  He said that this is important to stage it properly.  So we will see about that too.  One more step forward.  Thank you for your support.  I am grateful. Skippy
Posts.Title: What could happen? skippyrcis skippyrcis

Posts.Title: Anyone in Tampa FL area? mln8428 skippyrcis

Posts.Content: skippyrcis wrote: On Christmas Eve I had 2 masses removed from my right breast.  I had saline implants placed in April 08 and I could feel two bumps on top of my breast afterward.  I had an MRI in Feb 08 and my doc said everything was fine.  I am thinking the implants saved me.  My surgeon did not think I needed these masses removed but I wanted them out.  On January 2nd I read my pathology report.  Both pieces had cancer cells in them.  I have IDC, grade 1, and was told today that my hormone status was good.  (I don't understand what this means).  I am 39.  Our kids are 1 and 3 years old.  This is unbelievable since my husband's aunt died last year with breast cancer and his mother was diagnosised at the same time, followed by a sis-in-law (not blood related), now I have it.  It just seems too crazy.  I have been followed since 1998 with fibrocystic disease.  I am going to see a breast guy next Thursday and don't know what to ask.  This guy is highly recommeded but is not on our insurance plan.  The breast guy that is on our plan is supposed to be good, but if I can have the best I should go that route....right???  How much can all this cost?  Anyway, I would appreciate any answers or thoughts.  I know you have all been there and my head is just spinning with all this.  The crazy thing is that I am more worried about how my body will look than the important stuff.  I love my implants.  Could my brain be working this way for a reason?  Dx 1/2/2009, IDC, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: newbie here skippyrcis whippetmom

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2009 12:33PM skippyrcis wrote: Thank you so much for your responses.  I have been paying attention.  There is a chance that the Dr that has been so highly recommended will operate at the hospital where I work.  That would be great.  He does have priveledges.  I want to see him so I will keep my appointment for next week.  I have been busy working and trying to gather everything that I need.  Wow, that could be a full time job.  I do appreciate your time and kind words.
